macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Decline on Friday; Major Indices End Lower
items.summary: Wall Street indices fell on January 30, 2026, with Nasdaq down 0.94% (-223.31 points to 23,461.82), S&P 500 down 0.43% (-29.98 points to 6,939.03), Dow Jones down 0.36% (-179.09 points to 48,892.47), and Russell 2000 down 1.55%.[1][2][4]

items.title: Verizon Surges 6.6% on Strong Earnings; Chevron Up on Profit Beat
items.summary: Verizon rose 6.6% after stronger-than-expected results, while Chevron gained 0.5% on a profit beat; contrasts included American Express down 3.1% on earnings miss and ExxonMobil down 0.8%.[2]

items.title: Standout Stock Movers: RHI Up 27.76%, DECK Up 19.46%; PFSI Down 33.25%
items.summary: Robert Half International (RHI) surged 27.76% to 34.61 and Deckers Outdoor (DECK) rose 19.46% to 119.34, while PennyMac Financial (PFSI) dropped 33.25% to 99.92 and Unity Software (U) fell 24.22% to 29.10.[1]

items.title: January Gains Hold Despite Friday Pullback: S&P 500 Up 1.8% for Month
items.summary: Despite Friday's losses, S&P 500 is up 1.8% for January, Dow up 2.1%, and Nasdaq up 1.9%; US500 hit all-time high of 7002.58 earlier in January.[2]

items.title: UK FTSE 100 Rises 0.51% on Friday

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Crashes Below $81,000 Amid ETF Outflows and Geopolitical Tensions
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped below the $81,000 support level and entered bear market territory, falling 35% from its 2025 peak. The decline was driven by accelerating ETF outflows exceeding $1 billion for the month, geopolitical risks including Iran's threats, and the U.S. government shutdown.

items.title: Bitcoin Market Cap Reaches $1.65 Trillion as Price Stabilizes Around $82,700
items.summary: Bitcoin's market capitalization stands at $1.65 trillion as the cryptocurrency trades near $82,699, with the market attempting to find stability amid ongoing bearish pressure.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Microsoft Announces Maia 200 AI Inference Chip
items.summary: Microsoft unveiled Maia 200, a proprietary 3nm AI inference chip with FP4/FP8 tensor cores offering 3x performance over Amazonâ€™s Trainium 3rd gen, targeting markets like automated driving and manufacturing predictive maintenance.

items.title: Google DeepMind Releases AlphaGenome for Genetic Analysis
items.summary: DeepMind published AlphaGenome in Nature on January 29, an AI model analyzing up to 1 million DNA codes to predict genetic mutation impacts on diseases; model weights and API are free for research.

items.title: Amazon in Talks for $5 Billion Investment in OpenAI
items.summary: Amazon is negotiating a potential $5 billion investment in OpenAI amid booming AI inference market projected to reach 40 trillion yen.

items.title: Dario Amodei Predicts Rapid AI Advancements and $30T Valuations
items.summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei forecasts AI companies valued at $30T, recursive AI self-improvement in 1-2 years, and models soon handling full software engineering tasks.

items.title: Advances in AI Reasoning Models Like DeepSeek R1
items.summary: New reasoning-focused models such as DeepSeek R1 use reinforcement learning to self-train on attempts, enabling complex math and spatial problem-solving beyond prior LLMs.

items.title: LUQPI: Quantum-Enhanced Machine Learning with Minimal Quantum Use
items.summary: Researchers introduced Learning Under Quantum Privileged Information (LUQPI), achieving learning advantages using quantum feature extraction during training but classical algorithms like SVM+ for inference.

items.title: Helix 02 and 50% Insurance Cut for Self-Driving Tech
items.summary: Helix 02 announced alongside reports of 50% insurance reductions for self-driving vehicles, highlighting AI safety progress.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Nintendo Switch eShop Charts: Animal Crossing: New Horizons Tops List Again
items.summary: Animal Crossing: New Horizons remains at #1 on the Nintendo Switch eShop charts for the week of January 31, 2026, boosted by its 3.0.0 update and Nintendo Switch 2 Edition. Pokemon Legends: Z-A ranks #2, with other hits like Super Mario Galaxy and Minecraft following.[1]

items.title: Google's Project Genie AI Tool Sparks Gaming Stock Sell-Off
items.summary: Google unveiled Project Genie, an experimental AI tool using Genie 3 and Gemini models to generate 60-second interactive 720p/24 FPS game worlds from prompts, causing stock plunges for companies like Roblox, Nintendo, and CD Projekt Red amid investor fears over AI in game development.[4]

items.title: New World MMO Introduces Artemis as Major Villain in Vitae Aeternum Update
items.summary: Amazon's New World has added Artemis as one of the MMO genre's best villains in its Vitae Aeternum expansion, highlighted in recent coverage on January 31, 2026.[3]

items.title: New Free Games Roundup for January 31-February 1, 2026
items.summary: A comprehensive list of new free games to keep or play on PC, mobile, and Meta Quest is available this weekend, including various freebies and free-to-play titles.[5]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Samsung Teases Major Privacy Display Upgrade for Galaxy S26 Ultra
items.summary: Samsung has previewed a new 'privacy display' feature for the upcoming Galaxy S26 Ultra, described as a significant advancement in smartphone privacy protection. This bucks the trend of stagnant flagship features in recent years.

items.title: Xreal Smart Glasses Receive 3D Content Upgrade with Real 3D Feature
items.summary: Xreal has launched Real 3D for its One and One Pro smart glasses, enabling 3D viewing of any content from compatible devices with all processing handled on the glasses themselves. The feature enhances the glasses' virtual screen capabilities for entertainment.

items.title: Garmin's Leaked Whoop Clone Fitness Tracker Surfaces
items.summary: Garmin's rumored fitness tracker, resembling a Whoop clone, has leaked, potentially expanding its presence in the wearable fitness market.
